With limited information it does sound as though you have a bad download.
Recommendations: right click all files in this torrent > properties.
Look for the largest file. It should be 3.8GB or 3,850,360KB
3,850,360KB is an exact number if yours is different then you have an incomplete torrent.
That file should have an extension labeled as .iso (dot ISO)
I don?t remember the original name of this file because I make my own custom installers and had renamed this file.
If this file does not have an .iso at the end ? right click > rename to .iso extension

X, continued;
Download BurnAware (latest ver. 2.3.7 FREE here: http://www.burnaware.com/downloads.html)
BurnAware is super-easy no frills CD/DVD burning app; malware, spyware, adware FREE.  In BureAware navigate to DVD > disk imager > Burn iso image.

Again, this file is precisely 3,850,360KB. If your is different do not burn.

pagefile.sys is a temporary file created by windows so it can be deleted with not consequences at all. windows will create a new pagefile.sys on the fly.

Matter of fact you can configure to not create any pagefile.sys if you have enough RAM (4GB or more).

@manu_atjob

Installs fine with virtual drive. I have no idea what your talking about. Before I burned my copy when I accedently erased the boot record, I installed using a virtual drive and could dual boot with vista.

(For anyone whos wondering) heres how I did it:

I resized my NTFS partition that vista was installed on using EASEUS Partition Manager to 125 gigabytes - half my computers memory, than created a new NTFS Partition using the now available disk space and then mounted the downloaded ISO from the torrent using Daemon Tools Lite (the latest release from FileHippo.com). I told it to install on the NTFS partition I created that was not in use by Vista, it said copying temporary files, then asked to reboot. After rebooting setup continued and installed just fine. Seems like common sense to me.

BTW, I am typing this running Windows 7 Ultimate 64-bit from this torrent activated, and it runs like a dream. Better than XP and Vista by a longshot, Highly recommended. The only downside is no movie maker :P Paint is upgraded though and so are MANY other aspects from older windows versions, as well as new quirks and cool options too. Plus it boots up fast. 

It does ask for a serial number but just skip it and follow the torrent's directions :]

Thanks uploader!
